page.title: 01DELABOLE (SOUTH)
page.content: Delabole is a village famous for its slate quarry.It is sometimes called city of slate,with its slate roofs,slate paths,slate kerbstones,slate windowsills,even slate washing-line posts.Two miles to the west is the Atlantic Ocean,visible from the ridge 700 feet above sea level on which the greater part of Delabole is built.About eight miles to the east is Bodmin Moor. Matthew Haynes writes:"From Delabole we can see a big hill with granite caves and marshes. It is called Rough Tor. The granite piles are about 40 feet high. They look like massive beefburgers." The southern half of Delabole and the quarry is in this block, with surrounding farmland.
